intro: Senecio stigophlebius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and often have a silvery or woolly texture, while its flowers are small and yellow. It is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
